review: I love my new Fire Stick!It was a breeze to set up (except for opening the battery compartment on the remote - see YouTube for the solution). I really appreciate the HDMI extender, which I needed in order to make the connection on the back of my cramped HDTV.The Fire Stick is very easy to operate. And we really appreciate all the TV and movie choices available for "free" as part our Prime account.We never subscribed to HBO and/or Starz and now we have innumerable shows to choose from, plus new Amazon produced shows, like  "Transparent."We already had a  Netflix account and had been accessing it via an old Wii. Its display of shows was so old fashioned compared to how it now works using the Fire Stick. I also sampled some shows on Crackle, like Stenfeld's "Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee." (Funny/strange.)Before purchasing the Fire Stick, I researched the competition and found that Amazon's product got very good reviews from CNET, PC World and other technology websites. It has more memory than both Ruku and Chromecast. That extra memory makes for quick response time and an overall smoother operation.I highly recommend the Fire Stick.
